channel.title: A.I. on Nicholas Yek

item.title: Generalized CNF for "At Least k, given n variables"
item.description: I built this formula in preparation for CS3243 finals, but on hindsight it was overkill and the exam didn’t even need this… 😢 But, in the spirit of sharing, here’s my questionable formula and the method I obtained this. General CNF at least k, n variables For $n$ variables, $X = \set{x_1, x_2, …, x_n}$. Arrange them into combinations of k variables. Denote the set of k-variable combinations, $C = \set{c_1, c_2, …}$, or more formally in the following footnote^1.
